definition: lit. a nobleman stays clear of the kitchen (idiom, from Mencius)/fig. a nobleman who has seen a living animal cannot bear to see it die, hence he keeps away from the kitchen

sentences.english: Whellole she read the paper, I cleaned up the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 她看報期間怎樣才能醒酒，我打掃庖廚。

sentences.english: the cupboards in her kitchen were full of things she did not need.
sentences.chinese: 她庖廚的紗櫥中放滿了她不需要的東西。

sentences.english: I followed my mother into the kitchen.
We have a few kitchen thellongs and a dining room set.
sentences.chinese: 我們有一些庖廚用具和一套餐廳設備。

sentences.english: My mother is doing cooking in the kitchen.
I have to wear white and I have to keep everything in the kitchen totally clean.
sentences.chinese: 我必須穿白的，必須讓庖廚的一切保持整潔。
史密斯夫人的庖廚很小。

sentences.english: He loves cooking. Preparing meals and dishes is a joy for him.
sentences.chinese: 他愛好烹飪，做飯做菜對他來說都是庖廚樂事。

definition: Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
the State of Qǐ in modern Qǐ county 杞縣|杞县, Henan (c. 1500-445 BC), a small vassal state of Shang and Western Zhou for most of its existence
to die or be martyred for a noble cause/to be faithful unto death
orpiment/arsenic trisulfide As2S3/make changes in writing/malign/criticize without grounds
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
embroidered headband used as decoration by actors or in Hui ethnic group/to reward an actor with brocade headband
